imdb.plot outline: Inad was a knight among his tribe while Alia was the most beautiful among hers. She was the daughter of the Sheikh of the tribe and the sister of Mete'b, a knight who was famous for his great power and courage. She was the wished wife of all knights and chiefs of tribes, who flocked from all over to ask for her hand. But she refused all of them as in her eyes was the vision of Inad and in her heart was his love. Despite this, she was forced to marry the chief of one of the tribes. Inad announced he would release all prisoners and return all what was pillaged during the war for the sake of Alia's eyes. Upon the prisoners' return along with the camels and other spoils, one of the prisoners, who were angry with the Sheikh shouted, "It was Alia's eyes that freed us and not the courage of our people". The Sheikh flared up at hearing this, barged in Alia's room and said to her angrily , "Take whatever you need and whoever you want to escort you and go to your parents' house. You are divorced!" She answered him that she didn't want anything and would go to her parents alone.
imdb.title: Oyoun Alia
plot: The story of Alia and Inad who fall in love with each other at the first sight. They are torn apart by a tribal feud and have to go through so much pain and suffering to unite again.

Inad was a knight among his tribe while Alia was the most beautiful among hers. She was the daughter of the Sheikh of the tribe and the sister of Mete'b, a knight who was famous for his great power and courage. She was the wished wife of all knights and chiefs of tribes, who flocked from all over to ask for her hand. But she refused all of them as in her eyes was the vision of Inad and in her heart was his love. Despite this, she was forced to marry the chief of one of the tribes. Inad announced he would release all prisoners and return all what was pillaged during the war for the sake of Alia's eyes. Upon the prisoners' return along with the camels and other spoils, one of the prisoners, who were angry with the Sheikh shouted, "It was Alia's eyes that freed us and not the courage of our people". The Sheikh flared up at hearing this, barged in Alia's room and said to her angrily , "Take whatever you need and whoever you want to escort you and go to your parents' house. You are divorced!" She answered him that she didn't want anything and would go to her parents alone.
